intro: Sarcosperma affine, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Sarcosperma affine is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
